org.arl.fjage.param

Class ParameterMessageBehavior

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.arl.fjage.Behavior
      • org.arl.fjage.MessageBehavior
        • org.arl.fjage.param.ParameterMessageBehavior
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Behavior>

    public class ParameterMessageBehavior
extends MessageBehavior
    Behavior to handle parameter messages. To enable parameters on an agent, simply add this behavior during init() of the agent: 
     add(new ParameterMessageBehavior(MyParams.class));
    where enum MyParams lists the parameters supported by the agent. The parameters may be exposed as public attributes (read-only if marked final), getters/setters using JavaBean convention, or by overridding getParam(Parameter, int) and setParam(Parameter, int, Object) methods of this behavior.

    • Field Summary

      • onReceive

        public void onReceive(Message msg)
        Description copied from class: MessageBehavior
        This method is called for each message meeting the acceptance criteria of this behavior. A behavior must override this.
        Overrides:
        onReceive in class MessageBehavior
        Parameters:
        msg - received message.

      • getParameterList

        protected java.util.List<? extends Parameter> getParameterList()
        An agent supporting dynamic parameters may override this to return a list of parameters available.
        Returns:
        list of supported parameters, null if none supported.

      • getParameterList

        protected java.util.List<? extends Parameter> getParameterList(int ndx)
        An agent supporting dynamic parameters may override this to return a list of parameters available.
        Parameters:
        ndx - index for indexed parameters, -1 if non-indexed.
        Returns:
        list of supported parameters, null if none supported.

      • getParam

        protected java.lang.Object getParam(Parameter p,
                                    int ndx)
        Agents providing dynamic parameters may override this method to provide a value for a given parameter.
        Parameters:
        p - parameter to get value.
        ndx - index for indexed parameters, -1 if non-indexed.

        value of the parameter.

      • onParamChange

        protected void onParamChange(Parameter p,
                             int ndx,
                             java.lang.Object v)
        Agents may provide a behavior to be executed every time a parameter has been updated by overriding this method.
        Parameters:
        p - parameter to set value.
        ndx - index for indexed parameters, -1 if non-indexed.
        v - value of the parameter.

      • isReadOnly

        protected boolean isReadOnly(Parameter p,
                             int ndx)
        Agents providing dynamic parameters may override this method to specify whether a parameter is read-only or read-write. The default behavior of this method is to guess whether the parameter is read-only based on whether the associated atrribute is marked as final or from a missing setter in the Java bean convention.
        Parameters:
        p - parameter to check.
        ndx - index for indexed parameters, -1 if non-indexed.
        Returns:
        true if read-only, false if read-write.

      • allOf

        protected static java.util.List<? extends Parameter> allOf(java.lang.Class... paramEnumClasses)
        Generate a list of parameters from a parameter enumeration.
        Parameters:
        paramEnumClasses - enums representing the parameters.
        Returns:
        list of parameters.

      • processParameterReq

        protected ParameterRsp processParameterReq(ParameterReq msg,
                                           ParameterRsp rsp)
        Default handling of parameter requests is provided by this method. Agents wishing to have special handling may override this method.
        Parameters:
        msg - incoming parameter request.
        rsp - response message to fill in to send back, or null to create new one.
        Returns:
        response message
